column4: Hello...I am trying to recover files from a corrupt XP harddrive and booted to a live Ubuntu CD.  When i run fdisk -l I get nothing but a prompt, how bad is the situation?
chai; i can NOW* see that it is FAT32
chai; mtab says it is mounted but I still canot see it
chai; wait a minute, that drive on /dev/sda1 is my thumbdrive not the harddrive
chai; sudo fdisk -l gives me nothing again
chai, even on a live cd?
chai, as far as the XP drive itself is concerned, when I boot from that it might/might not make it as far as the wavy logo screen and then it just restarts all over again
chai, typically I can get data off these things but this one is stubborn
little bit about the kernel, some stuff on /var more on /dev and /tmp
sounds like its not mounted to me
I agree but I think Ubuntu does not know it is there for mounting
have your tried mounting it manually?
with something like mount -t ntfs-3g /dev/sda1 /media/disk -o force
the thing is fdisk -l does not see this harddrive
